revised_title: Cenozoic Volcanism in Antarctica: A Review of Main Episodes and Tectonic Implications
tldr: This article discusses the main Cenozoic volcanic episodes in Antarctica and examines their significance in relation to the tectonic processes that occurred in the region. It explores the volcanic activity in the South Sandwich Islands, South Shetland Islands, and other regions, and how they are related to the dynamic processes of plate tectonics and the evolution of the Earth's crust.
